intro: Sida praelonga, commonly known as long-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, woolly leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and stamens that are often hairy. Sida praelonga is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
